other_tests.findings: adenocarcinoma of the prostate was made (Gleason score, 6 [grade 3 plus grade 3]) involving less than 5% of one of six cores of tissue examined
benign-appearing bladder with some irregularities of the prostatic urethra
two small papillary projections in the prostatic urethra, which were resected
adenocarcinoma cells lining the prostatic urethra (adenocarcinoma in situ) and invading the adjacent prostate stroma
other_tests.changes_over_time: The diagnosis was confirmed as urothelial-type adenocarcinoma which was attributed to radiation exposure.

other_tests.findings: abnormal signal in the prostate and right seminal vesicle, features that were consistent with postradiation changes; cancer involving the prostate and right seminal vesicle could not be ruled out

other_tests.procedure_name: pathological examination of prostatic urethral tumor biopsy
other_tests.findings: similar to previous specimens, positive for CK20 and CDX2, negative for PSA and PSAP
